ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned so much! Truly a great experience and an amazing introduction to biological research techniques!

I gained insight into, and worked with, many model organisms!
I also gained laboratory techniques.

The course has definitely taught me many new lab techniques and introduced many model organisms to work with within the realm of biology. Although the labs themselves were very enjoyable, I often found myself in a state of confusion, not knowing what is going on with everything. However, this class has definitely taught me to manage stress levels and taught me the basics of working in a lab.
I learned basic bio lab techniques!
Incredible course to learn the basics of laboratory research, definitely very useful for future lab courses.
I learned so much in the class from pipetting, gel elctrophoresis, ELISA, crossing flies, and so much more.
I learned basic bio wet-lab skills, how to write an experimental report, and how to use several key model organisms.
I learned about molecular, cellular, and developmental biology principles as well as laboratory skills and principles.
I learned how to apply my knowledge from the BIOL intro series. This helped strengthen my biology knowledge and understand how it can be utilized.

I learned foundational biology laboratory skills to help me prepare for lab work over the summer. I also learned how to communicate scientific information effectively and accurately to a wider audience through the lab reports.

The class does a great job introducing various model organisms, experimental techniques, experimental thought processes, and fields of study. This is great if you are looking for more exposure to biological research.
I learned basic lab skills and how to write detailed lab reports and lab notebook entries.
I learned a lot about lab techniques and biology.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I wish the instructor was more transparent about what she expected from us on certain assignments like notebook checks.
I enjoyed the way the course was very casual and collaborative. I believe the course could be more organized at times.

The major strength is how the professor cared about the student's time and well-being and often very flexible with due dates. The major weakness of this course was how disorganized and unclear the instructions were, which often brought confusion of lab execution and writing about the lab in the lab notebook or report.

Stengths: I liked the pace of the course. Because it is known to be an introductory bio lab, Prof Moreno always waited to make sure everyone was on the same page before moving on.

Weaknesses: The lab reports took way too much time. I would easily spend 12 hours on one lab report, but to be fair, she does give you 2 weeks to complete it. I just think that given the work load and the time spent in class, the class should be worth 1 credit and not 0.5.

Strengths- your lab writing skills really improve and you learn softwares such as Prism

Weaknesses- none
There are no weaknesses
This course present very useful skills without requiring too much work. Very clear guidance on how to write the reports.
strengths - teaching staff is very supportive and encouraging; weaknesses - n/a

Strengths: We received helpful feedback on assignments and useful guides for reports. 

Weaknesses: Some of the labs were quite lengthy and we sometimes left without a strong understanding of them.

Strengths: I loved every lab session we did, especially the ones involving model organisms such as C. elegans and zebrafish. 

Weaknesses: The course felt a little confusing at times, where instructions for certain assignments (e.g. lab reports and notebook checks) felt a little dense and unclear

I think that in the beginning, the lab portion was a little confusing (it seemed more like I was just following a set of instructions) and I didn't understand how to do the lab reports. However, it was very engaging and I learned a lot as the semester went on.
This class is a lot of work, but it's so worth it because you learn a ton.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If interested in research then for sure!

I would recommend this student during the first few years of college when they are trying to decide if they would like to pursue research and gain skills in research at Yale. Dr. Moreno is very kind and helpful with guiding students to healthy labs!

I would not recommend this course to anyone who has no lab experience or knowledge of biology because this course, although considered to be "introductory", was very intensive and often brought unnecessary confusion, misery, and stress in the work that comes along with the lab itself.
Yes! If you're looking for another bio lab I recommend.
Yes, all students pursuing laboratory research should take this course because you really build on pipetting skills, writing skills, and how to compile data in a lab notebook.
Yes, this is a very good course for learning basic skills necessary for research in biology.
Yes, i would recommend this class to students looking to improve their laboratory skills and strengthen basic biology knowledge.
Yes, it is a bio lab that will leave you with a stronger application knowledge of biology. It is a bit challenging at times but overall it was useful.

Definitely, especially if the student has little to no prior lab experience. This class is a great way to gain exposure to the lab environment and also provides lists of many labs to join over the summer.
I recommend this course if you are looking for a general introduction to biological research. It covers in-lab techniques and rationale while also helping with your scientific writing.
Yes, I think that this course was a good introduction to biology lab.
I would definitely recommend this course to students who have no experience in a biology lab. I think this lab teaches you a lot of basic biology skills that are useful in the field.
YES!  This is the best bio lab you'll take at this school.
